studentdata.projectDesc: The problem that I aim to solve with this project is “How do I secure my room, while I am away from the house?” The goal of my project is to create a motion triggered detection system that will alert me, anytime that somebody comes into my room. The camera will send pictures and videos straight into Google Drive, and alert me via email notification if an event has occurred.
studentdata.keywords: Raspberry Pi, Security, Camera, MotionEyeOS, Email

studentdata.projectDesc:
In this security lab, the objective lies in the configuration of the system service and device driver 
System Monitor, analyzing the output, and further tuning the configuration based on the needs of 
the administrator. The data can then be visualized, and more deeply interpreted through cloud 
integration in the Elastic Stack (ELK).
studentdata.keywords: Security, Cloud integration, Log Analysis, System Monitor, ELK stack

studentdata.projectDesc: For my project I decided to build a chess clock using an Arduino MEGA microcontroller, I’ve been passionate about chess since I was young, and the last item needed for competitive games with my friends was a working chess clock. My goal for this project is to create a chess clock using an Arduino microcontroller that can announce a winner and activate a buzzer when a timer reaches zero. I went through a few different designs but settled on a simple square look with two buttons on top and an LCD screen for the timers. A 30-minute timer is used for both players with the other players timer being activated when the opposing player presses their button to end their turn. Once a timer reaches zero a buzzer goes off and a message displays on the LCD screen saying who won.
studentdata.keywords: Arduino MEGA, Chess Clock, DIY project, microcontrolle

studentdata.projectDesc: The purpose of this project is to utilize Windows PowerShell to implement network defenses and cyber security best practices remotely from another Windows device. Using two Windows devices on a common network we are able to remote connect using PowerShell. After remoting you are able to utilize Windows Defender Firewall and any other security practices. From the comfort of your own computer you can secure a computer and its’ network remotely. Once you are familiar with the commands, remoting with Windows PowerShell will save you time and hassle.

Have you ever missed the feeling of playing older video games such as Mario? For my capstone project I am going to help solve that problem and help you relive your past by the help of using a Raspberry Pi. A Raspberry Pi is a relatively small computer that is budget friendly. It carries the ability to be plugged into a TV or monitor and can be controlled by a standard keyboard and mouse. I installed an OS called RetroPie that allows you to play games from various consoles. The key functionality of the project is to: run your favorite games, like the classic Mario and Donkey Kong, and its compact size can allow it to fit in your pocket and be used almost anywhere.

This project is a solution to the problem of having to get on a computer or smartphone to check the price of a cryptocurrency. The proposed solution is to have a device you can plug into a computer that will track, display, and update the price of a desired cryptocurrency. The proposed solution can be  completed with a Raspberry Pi Zero, 2.13” e-ink screen, a MicroSD card, and a computer to configure the SD card and Raspberry Pi Zero.
studentdata.keywords: Raspberry Pi Zero, Cryptocurrency, Tracker, SSH, Putty, Python

studentdata.projectDesc: The purpose of this project is to create a readily accessible way to build a lightweight Kubernetes server using a Raspberry Pi. The goal is less functionality and more on a proof of concept of developing cloud technologies. Creating an introductory project such as this could get more people interested in cloud computing, networking, and basic database management earlier in their education. The Raspberry Pi stack will act as the our main server or “master node” and we will use it to connect to a database and edit the database through the K3S server.

The project aims to answer the question: “How can I keep watch over my apartment”. This project aims to provide a low-cost surveillance system offering customization and scalability, as well as having an email notification alert system from motion detection. If someone enters the apartment, I will receive an email notification to alert me.

With our world becoming more anxious to know the innermost part of our lives through curious thieves and suspicious people, some type of surveillance system to protect and monitor your property or home is inevitable. Many times before, there were instances where if a camera was present to see what had happened at a scene at a given time, suspects could be identified in a significantly shorter amount of time than if the camera was not there. Sometimes, just the sight of a security camera on the corner of a house or a home security sign in the front yard is enough to evade the possibility of crime or vandalism of your property.
studentdata.keywords: Security, Surveillance system, Camera, AI detection

studentdata.projectDesc:
In today’s world, there is a need to monitor one’s premises. I proposed a solution of adding a camera system on the outside of my home to monitor and record triggers to a computer located in my home. I designed a surveillance IP based network and implemented this network in my home. I sketched the proposed network and planed the equipment and parts needed. This included a PoE switch, four cameras, cat 6 cable, cable crimpers and jacks for the cables. I installed these around my home, through the PoE switch. Using a computer that is networked to the switch, I installed a program called Blue Iris. 
This program allows me to set up and control each camera individually, and it allows me to controlmany features, such as triggers, PTZ (pan, tilt, zoom – if supported by the cameras), notifications, etc. The design of the network and hardware will allow me to expand the camera system in the future.
studentdata.keywords: Blue Iris, cable crimpers, cameras, CCA (copper-clad aluminum), ethernet, PoE switch, pure copper, RJ-45, triggers
